state_analysis: The current attempts to create the test script are failing due to improperly formatted escape characters, which are leading to syntax errors when the script is run. Each attempt to run the script results in the same errors.
explanation: To resolve this issue, I will create the test script again, ensuring that no problematic characters are included, particularly avoiding the exclamation mark. I will also ensure to format the script correctly without unnecessary escape characters. After creating the script successfully, I will run it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo 'import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print("Test passed!")' > test_script.py
